doc.after: A composite rhythm is the durations and patterns rhythm produced by amalgamating all sounding parts of a musical texture In music of the common practice period the composite rhythm usually confirms the meter often in metric or even note patterns identical to the pulse on a specific metric level White defines composite rhythm as the resultant overall rhythmic articulation among all the voices of a contrapuntal texture White 1976 136
